data.title: Make TinyXML and SimXMLDocument use the virtual file system.
data.body:
As described in issue #643, this pull requests aims to modify the TinyXML library in a way that doesn't affect current behaviour, but makes it possible to use FileStreams for working with the xml files, which is necessary to work with T3D's virtual file system (e.g. works inside Zip folders and stuff like that)

This Pull Request has some issues (such as placement of files and not being able to automatically merge) which I'll fix if we deem it is useful to T3D.

It's split into 4 commits: 
- dd4ae89 fixes some inconsistencies between T2D and T3D in the Stream objects.
- 50c65b5 Makes the TinyXML library more inheritance friendly.
- f40d50a Adds FileStream versions of the TinyXML classes.
- ba9bccf Alters the the SimXMLDocument classes to make use of the virtual file system through the FileStream versions of the TinyXML classes.

They are dependent on each other from bottom to top.

So is this a change we want in T3D? Discuss.

data.title: Modify TinyXML to use FileStream
data.body:
We should modify TinyXML to use FileStream as they have done in T2D, so that it is compatible with T3D's virtual file system (e.g. reading files inside zip files)
As pointed out by TRON in IRC:

> it won't work with the virtual file system, therefore things like storing files that library tries to open in zip archives would fail.

Breaks the "lib"-properties of TinyXML, but it should be done imo.

Issue is that collada_dom relies on TinyXML so integrating it directly into T3D makes collada_dom rely on the T3D DLL which is bad practice, but I guess collada_dom should use the virtual file system as well?

data.title: Use Assimp to import static shape files
data.body: To enable more file types, we should use Assimp to import static shapes. No animations for now. As seen in [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/137168).

data.body:
```
void _StringTable::resize(const U32 _newSize)
{   
   ...
   temp->next = buckets[key % newSize]; // possible 0 division
   buckets[key % newSize] = temp; // possible 0 division
}
```

data.title: Change all member vars to use mMemberName naming

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: As of now, lots of classes have members which named like `codeSize` which could bring some confusion with local vars. Renaming those to `mCodeSize` will make the code be more clear and readable.

data.body:
This commit adds a "Coverage" option to the procedural terrain
generator. Allows mixing of textures. See
http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22371 for more info.
This version has many improvements - coverage is now entered as a
percentage, accepts decimals, and doesn't have any bugs as far as I
know. 

Lol hope this is finally acceptable.

data.body:
Process::_signalProcess is destroyed first, and then Win32WindowManager::~Win32WindowManager() try to remove from deleted Signal causing a crash.

SlotSignal handle this automatically.

data.title: Explosion is not networked properly

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
This issue has persisted for a long time. Creating an `Explosion` on the server, using [this function](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/a31e6a755c3f111afa506b39e0c1a4b88d72732a/Engine/source/T3D/fx/explosion.cpp#L109) for example, will not create the explosion for any clients.

Solution: either make `Explosion` work as expected, provide a utility function to do so easily, or at the very least remove that example in `explosion.cpp`.

EDIT: Decided that this is a documentation issue. Will be resolved for 3.6.

data.title: Use gtest framework for unit tests

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
Torque 2D [currently uses](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque2D/blob/development/engine/source/testing/unitTesting_ScriptBinding.h) the [googletest](https://code.google.com/p/googletest/) framework for unit testing. As discussed in #595 and #592, maybe we should do that as well. I'm happy to do this if we decide it's a good idea.

EDIT: [Working branch](https://github.com/eightyeight/Torque3D/tree/gtest)

data.title: CMake generates solutions in project root

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
At the moment, CMake generates something like this on Windows:

```
My Projects/
    - Project/
        - game/
            - main.cs
            - scripts/
            - art/
            - etcetera...
        - Project.sln
        - ALL_BUILD.vcproj
        - INSTALL.vcproj
        - CMakeFiles/
        - Tools/
        - Win32/
```

It would be great if everything underneath `etcetera` could be swept under some rug, the way the project manager creates a folder in `buildFiles` for each platform/compiler. Otherwise multi-platform builds in the same source tree will get messy.

data.title: CMake generated solution has ALL_BUILD as startup project

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: This means that to debug/run the engine you need to switch your startup project after creating the solution. I suggest looking into [this](http://stackoverflow.com/a/12758553/945863) solution to make `ALL_BUILD` run the executable.

data.title: Handle texel-pixel offset with diferents graphics APIs.

milestone.title: OpenGL3
milestone.description:
This milestone tracks the progress of adding an OpenGL rendering backend to the engine alongside the current DirectX backend, which is unfortunately the only backend of the abstracted GFX interface. This will allow OpenGL rendering on multiple platforms, but specifically OXS and Linux.

[Working branch.](https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/dev_linux_opengl)

data.body:
DX9 has texel-pixel offset. 

Dx11 and OpenGL don't.
